projections.assumption: Continued strong subscription growth, slightly decelerating from 2025 guidance but still robust due to AI momentum and large customer expansion. Margin expansion driven by operating leverage.
Further deceleration in revenue growth, but still above market average. Continued margin improvement as the company scales and optimizes operations.
Growth moderates further but remains strong, reflecting the law of large numbers. Margin expansion continues at a slower pace.
Revenue growth stabilizes at a healthy double-digit rate. Margins approach a more mature level.
Revenue growth continues to decelerate towards a sustainable long-term rate. Margins show slight further improvement.

sections.assumptions:
Assumptions based on robust analysis:

• Revenue Growth: Subscription revenue growth will drive overall revenue, with a gradual deceleration from ~22% in 2026 to 13% by 2030, reflecting the law of large numbers but sustained by AI platform adoption and enterprise expansion. (High Confidence)
• EBITDA Margin: EBITDA margin will expand from 22.8% in 2025 to 28.5% by 2030, driven by operating leverage inherent in the subscription model and efficiency gains. (High Confidence)
• FCF Margin: FCF margin will improve from 34% in 2025 to 37% by 2030, reflecting strong profitability and efficient capital allocation. (High Confidence)
• Exit Multiple: A terminal P/E multiple of 50x is used, reflecting ServiceNow's strong growth prospects, high profitability, and market leadership in enterprise workflow automation. (Medium Confidence)
• Discount Rate: A discount rate of 9% is used, reflecting the company's established market position and relatively stable cash flows, balanced against its growth stage. (High Confidence)

Key Drivers:
• Growth: Subscription revenue growth driven by strong demand for AI-powered platform solutions and expansion of large enterprise customer base (553 customers >$5M ACV).
• Profitability: Operating leverage from scaling subscription model and continued focus on operational efficiency, supported by management's guidance for non-GAAP operating margin and FCF margin.
• Risks: Intense competition in the enterprise software market and potential for economic downturns impacting enterprise IT spending.
